utterance.speaker: ANAHITA MENEDEZ
utterance.content: Mrs. Barclay? It’s Anahita Menendez.

utterance.speaker: ANAHITA
utterance.content: Anahita from 4D. I lost my purse and my keys. Would you please buzz me up?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Well, thank you, darling.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, what do you think of Rick’s PI venture?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, it’s always been a big fantasy of his to be a private investigator and he says that things are picking up, he’s getting more calls at the office every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, from fans wanting to meet him. Or people with crazy theories about where he disappeared to for two months. Or cases that aren’t even worth looking into, like missing cats.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that does seem a bit beneath him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, he did this because he was hoping that we would be able to work together again and he thought he might have some interesting cases to solve, but right now it doesn’t seem like he’s getting much of either.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, and if I know my son, then – – he may be sticking with it because he’s too proud to walk away.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, you’re in a good mood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because I have retooled the Richard Castle Investigations website.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: A ha!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now the entire world can have access to my savvy detective skills. Though I will take only the most compelling cases, rife with mystery and intrigue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, the site looks amazing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My clients deserve only the best.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of clients, it looks like I’ve got one. I better get going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too. A private investigator must keep regular office hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, my murder’s in the Village, right near your office. You want to walk me to work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, busy day ahead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: While I admit the public clamor for Richard Castle Investigations has been somewhat muted, I do have a meeting with a client this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, a case rife with mystery and intrigue, I hope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not … exactly, though I will gain some classic gumshoe experience. The client wants me to do a background check on the daughter’s new boyfriend. The boyfriend is sixteen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, you’ve got nothing to prove here. To me or to anyone else. Now, is this what you really want to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m just starting out. I mean, I’ve got to become established, right? I’ve got to pay my dues. What do you – what do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that if this is what you really want to do, then I’m behind you all the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. And once I do become established, much like my Nikki Heat novels were inspired by you, my new series of PI novels will be inspired by me. I’ll be my own muse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should have stopped at “thanks”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hum. Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Old habits. Uh, have a good day at work, honey.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle trying to crash the crime scene again?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, actually. He’s got a case of his own. So, what’s the word on ours?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh. Sanitation worker found our victim hidden under some trash bags here. She’s Anahita Menendez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anahita? That’s an Arabic name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, her mom’s Lebanese, but she’s Colombian.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you know this how?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s a famous telenovela actress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You watch telenovelas?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No … no. But my tía does. She’s a huge fan of Anahita’s show, Santos Desesperadas. Desperate Saints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She plays a brilliant young neurosurgeon. At least that’s what my tía says.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hum. Hey Perlmutter. So, tell me about our victim.

utterance.speaker: SIDNEY PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Detective Beckett. So pleasant to see you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: And not see Castle. Uh, signs of struggle, and then death came by way of a blow to the head, delivered with such savage force it cranial vault, killing her instantly.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is the murder weapon. It’s a length of plumber’s pipe. There’s a bunch of scrap pieces in that trash bin over there.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Our perp may have argued with her before he took that swing. Neighbors said that they overheard some loud voices coming from outside right around the time of death, a man and a woman’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So maybe this was spontaneous. A crime of passion committed by someone she knew.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or she might have been killed by a psychotic plumber lying in wait.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That your Castle theory?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It needs work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, you don’t go to the movies dressed like this, so let’s find out where she came from last night. Trouble might have followed her home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I, uh … actually tracked down the studio where they film the telenovela. They may know.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA DEL CORDOVA
utterance.content: She’s half your age! You are the mayor and my husband. This torrid affair will ruin us both. And what if she talks?

utterance.speaker: MANUEL VILLALOBOS
utterance.content: It was a moment of weakness. Please forgive me, my love. Besides, that girl won’t live to tell another soul. I’m making sure of it myself. Tonight … on the yacht!

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Tonight? What if someone sees you?

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: Please, my love –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, so I figured out who we have to talk to. His name is Francisco Herrara. He oversees the show for the network. He’s … right over … there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sofia Del Cordova. A legend. A megastar. Chiquitas, Fuego de la Pasión. Caminos De Amor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Chiquitas?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Her costar over there, Manuel Villalobos, he and Sofia used to be married. Now he just rides her coattails and uses his influence over her to get his role beefed up on the show. At least, I mean, that’s what I’ve heard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure it’s your tía who’s a fan?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As a man of fortitude and character, I will resist the temptation to weasel in on your investigation, but I must confess I have major case envy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you heard about Anahita Menendez?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I talked to a uniform at the scene. Is it true? Rising young telenovela star struck down at her apartment? Why do you get all the cases rife with mystery and intrigue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not to mention sultry tempestuous men and women and over the top acting.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Seems real to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See, now you’re just torturing me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Cheer up, Castle. You’ve got a client of your own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, the client just called. The daughter and boyfriend broke up, so no more background check. Who’s your prime suspect? Let me live vicariously.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what, Castle? I have to go. I have a witness that we have to talk to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve got to go, too. I’ve got a call, uh, on the other line. Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO HERRARA
utterance.content: I’m devastated. Anahita was an amazing person and a gifted actor. Very convincing as a neurosurgeon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Herrara, how well did you know her?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: Very well. I discovered Ana three years ago in Colombia and we’ve been together ever since. She was a rising star. We just came off her promotional tour. Barcelona and Dubai and Miami. She already had fans all over the world.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We heard that she went out last night. Do you know where?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: I’m afraid I don’t, but Sofia might know. They were close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she have any relationship problems?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Issues with any over-zealous fans or … stalkers?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: No, but there was a terrible incident with Marcus Segundo, her assistant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: Ana got upset with Marcus for interrupting her when she was memorizing her lines. He lost it. He attacked her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As in, he hit her?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: He tried to. The crew intervened, but Ana wasn’t hurt. She was shaken up, as you can imagine. She needed a few days off to recover. Of course, I fired Marcus on the spot, but he was furious and he threatened to kill Ana if he ever saw her again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, we need to talk to this guy. Where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: I have his contact information in my office. I can get it for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: It is truly a tragedy when death strikes one so young.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Manuel, that’s the same thing you said to the parents of the child who fell down the well in episode 347.

utterance.speaker: MANUEL
utterance.content: And it is as true now as it was then.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Del Cordova. I’m Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: It’s such terrible news. I just saw Ana last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she mention where she was headed?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: To the Upper West Side. To the event of some kind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She told you that?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: No. I just assumed because she asked to borrow my purse. An Arthur Radcliffe diamond studded clutch. Was it found on her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Ana buzzed her neighbor because she lost it. Why?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: She lost it? That purse was on loan from a boutique. It’s due back tomorrow. If I don’t return it I will owe them a fortune.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Ms. Del Cordova, I can’t help you. But um … if I come across it I’ll let you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Actually, about that purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was 11 in the morning. My phone was quieter than a dead church mouse. My head hurt after hitting the sauce like there was no tomorrow. For all I knew, there was no tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was about to pour a smile in my coffee, have a little hair of the dog that bit me when she walked in.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Señor Castle.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m looking for a private investigator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was, um … just putting this away.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: So, I haven’t met many private eyes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I haven’t met many clients. Yet. So far. So far today. Um … would you have a seat, Ms. –

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Del Cordova. Sofia Del Cordova.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, as in Sofia Del Cordova who worked with the late Anahita Menendez?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Sadly, yes. That is why I’m here. Detective Beckett recommended you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She did?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: She said you’re the best.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, she’s absolutely right. And completely unbiased. I knew she’d come around. Uh, why don’t we get right to business, shall we? Uh, just as soon as I find a pencil. Perfect timing. Okay, let’s start with Anahita Menendez. What can you tell me about her death?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Just that she borrowed my purse for the evening, she lost the purse and was killed outside her apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did Ana have any enemies that she knew of?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but why are you asking me about Ana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because she’s the victim.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: No, I’m the victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean emotionally speaking, because you lost your friend.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Because I lost my purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your purse?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Detective Beckett is investigating Ana’s death but the purse is still missing. I need it found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want me to find your purse.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Not just any purse and not mine. It’s an Arthur Radcliffe original clutch, on loan to me and due back tomorrow by 5PM. It cost $500,000. It looks just like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s worth half a million dollars?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Will you find it, Mr. Castle? I don’t know who else to turn to.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So the canvass turned up a witness who saw a man fleeing the scene after Ana was killed. Witness is a homeless guy. We’ve got him with a sketch artist right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what does this fleeing man look like?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … youngish. Six feet, two hundred pounds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like Marcus Segundo, the assistant who attacked Ana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His Metro card shows that he rode in from the Bronx last night and he got off at a stop near Ana’s neighborhood. He also has priors for assault with intent.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would Ana hire a guy like that to be her assistant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Francisco Herrera said that she had a rough upbringing as well and she wanted to give Marcus a chance. She trusted him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like she shouldn’t have. Where is he now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo’s bringing him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll let you take that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. Hello?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You referred a case to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you took it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course I did. That way we get to work together. Sort of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I just – I didn’t know if you’d be excited by a lost purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A purse? I’m sorry, this is not just an ordinary purse. This is a diamond encrusted clutch. It’s on par with the priceless Maltese Falcon and I am on the trail. Matter of fact, I’m about to pore over a list of events that Ana may have attended last night – unless of course you’re willing to tell me where she went, now that we’re on the same team.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I wish I could help you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I get it. Church and state.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That, and we don’t know where she went. So it looks like you’re going to have to do some actual police work. You know, hit the streets. Start canvassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Canvassing? Oh, that thing you get Espo and Ryan to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I suggest that you wear comfortable shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marcus, why’d you take the train into the city last night?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: To hit a bar in Chelsea. What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you there all night?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: No. Had a few beers and left around 11:30. Walked around a little.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like to Ana’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: What’s Ana got to do with this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: What? Ana’s dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Murdered by someone who impulsively hit her with a pipe. A witness saw a man matching your description leaving the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Me? It wasn’t me. Are you crazy? I would never hurt Ana.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You attacked her on set in front of the entire crew.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: Yeah, but that whole thing was staged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is hard to believe.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: No, I’m telling you it’s true. Ana came to me. She said she needed me to start that fight with her. She paid me $3,000 because she knew it would cost me my job. But even she promised to give me a better one in a few weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she pay you to attack her?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: She said she needed to get away for a couple of days. But the show wouldn’t give her any time off. So she had me cause that scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she did all of that to skip out on work. Why?

utterance.speaker: MARCUS
utterance.content: I don’t know. She’d gotten really secretive lately. Taking meetings and not telling me what they were for. She was up to something. Maybe whatever it was got her killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marcus’s alibi checks out. Street cams caught him in SoHo at the time of the murder. He’s not our killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, that would be this guy. Sketch came in from the homeless man. Definitely not Marcus Segundo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, if we could figure out where Ana went to last night, that might tell us who this guy is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her credit card says that she paid for a taxi. We’re still trying to run down where it took her, though.

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me? Auditorium doesn’t open for another five hours, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not here for the opera, Ronnie. Richard Castle, private investigator. I wonder if I could ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Oh, wow. I thought you were a writer. What happened?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing happened. I’m just expanding my brand, if that’s all right with you. Look, did you see this woman last night?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Definitely. She was here for the premiere of Rigoletto.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sure. This woman?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Yeah. Positive. I mean, come on. You really think I could forget her? She’s smoking hot. You know what the weird thing is, though? Is that she arrived way late. Like a few minutes before it ended late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you notice if she was carrying this purse with her?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. I remember that, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could you direct me to where she was sitting? It could be where she left the purse.

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Uh, she actually didn’t go to her seat. She went straight to the restroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello? Private investigator investigating –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The ladies’ room, Castle? Did you not see the sign?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You knew Ana came here and you wouldn’t share?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I just found out. She got dropped off here by a cab. You?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, only six events held last night would require a gown and evening gloves and the opera was one. Hi.

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not bad. So, Pam here was just telling me she saw Ana last night and she witnessed something very strange.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? What – what was the strange thing you witnessed?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Well, she came in, very pleasant. Said hi; not everyone does that. But then she went to the corner and met with this other young woman. Pretty, dark hair. She looked Middle Eastern, maybe. I saw her give Ana a flash drive stick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean like a USB drive?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: Exactly. They didn’t say a word to each other, and then Ana up and slipped that USB thing in her purse and snuck out like she didn’t want to be seen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the woman that gave Ana the USB drive, did you know her? Or do you know anything about her?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: She looked familiar, so she may be a season ticket holder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need a list of those names. Is your manager in?

utterance.speaker: PAM
utterance.content: I’ll go find her for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A clandestine meeting at the opera house. A mysterious Middle Eastern woman passes a flash drive to the victim hours before her death. Perhaps our telenovela actress was actually a covert operative.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She may very well be, but I don’t know how that’s going to help you find her purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet find it I will!

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Sir, can you please leave now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ronnie, do you happen to remember where that woman went after she left the restroom?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Yes, sir. The performance ended and she exited the building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You saw her leave?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Right.

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: See, I was our front helping patrons into their cars when I saw her head for a white limo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She left in a limo? Did she have the purse with her?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Yep. You know, that smoking hot detective was really interested in the limo, too, and I told her all this earlier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me earlier?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: You didn’t ask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – – that’s a valid point. All right, I’m asking now. Please tell me everything you remember about that limo. I have a client who’s counting on this.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I got your text, Mr. Castle. So? Ana was picked up by a white stretch limo when she left the opera? Where did she go then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s what I’m trying to find out. Does that limo sound familiar to you?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: No. Ana usually ordered limos through the show and our service only has black town cars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, well, do you know anyone who would have ordered a limo for Ana or maybe given her one for the evening?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: She was a celebrity. We get limos all the time. The limo could have come from anywhere. But this UBS drive. This concerns me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what was on it? What could Ana have been mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I have no idea. But if the purse was taken because someone wanted this UBS, I will never get it back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except Ana buzzed her neighbor and specifically told her she left the purse, not that it was stolen. Now, my next step is to contact the taxi and limousine commission, locate that limo. Wherever it took Ana, that’s probably where she lost the purse.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: So this limo is your only clue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course not. No, I have my best operatives in the field, shaking the trees, generating leads. And uh – I just think that this limousine is very promising.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: It doesn’t sound so promising to me, Mr. Castle. And we have less than a day ‘til the deadline. Call me with an update by this evening.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No progress on that limo or where Ana went after the opera, but we did ID the woman who gave her that flash drive. Layla Nazif. Tracked her down from her box seats at the opera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who is she?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She is the daughter of Abdul Nazif - - billionaire and high ranking Saudi official. He’s in town on UN business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why was Ana involved with the daughter of a Saudi official?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s not the only person she was involved with. I did some digging and it turns out she went to the Tremaine Hotel for the same two days she took off work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Some of the staff saw her hanging out with this guy. Herman Eckles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The real estate tycoon? What was she doing with him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I called his office to find out. Got stonewalled. Eckles' people deny he even knew Ana.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. A secret rendezvous with a shadowy real estate magnate, a flash drive exchange with Layla Nazif, the daughter of a Saudi official. Ana was half Lebanese. Perhaps this is some kind of espionage plot and Ana found her way –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: - wrapped in a web of intrigue. And like the -

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro. You’re doing it again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Plus, Castle already pitched spies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, well … great minds. Oh, Perlmutter. He’s got something for us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll talk to Layla Nazif.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll go see what Perlmutter has.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what I have. A clue that may hold the key to who committed this murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And that clue would be?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: You see, murders are not solved by positing outlandish, fanciful theories. Sad to say, a habit you seem to be acquiring, Detective Ryan. No, crimes are solved by applying the scientific method.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So are you going to show us what you found or are you just going to stand here and talk about it?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: There are bruises on the victim’s wrist as if the killer seized her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, signs of a struggle. We already know that.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, but what you don’t know is that the killer left a print. After painstaking examination I recovered an intact print here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you run it through the system?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I leave that to lesser minds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for taking time, Ms. Nazif. I see you brought your lawyer.

utterance.speaker: LAYLA NAZIF
utterance.content: My father insisted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I need to ask you about Anahita Menendez.

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: Simply awful. I admired her so much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was your relationship?

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: We were acquaintances. You see, I adored telenovelas, much to the disapproval of my father. The passion and the drama … Ana had such talent. She and I met at social functions from time to time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like at the opera?

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: The opera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I gather that the two of you met at the opera last night.

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: I did no such thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we have a witness that saw you –

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: That witness is mistaken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You gave Ana a flash drive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was on it?

utterance.speaker: LAYLA
utterance.content: Your information is incorrect and I am not obliged to speak with you, Detective. I have diplomatic immunity. This meeting is over.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So you think Layla is behind the killing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but she’s clearly hiding something. Ryan, where are we on that print that Perlmutter found?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got an ID off the military database and it matches our sketch. This is our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harlan Mathis?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s out of Vegas, ex-Marine, worked in private security but now he’s freelance. And word is he’ll pretty much do anything if the price is right, including wet work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why send a hired gun like Mathis after a telenovela star?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s find Mathis and ask him about Ana’s murder. Put out an APB and alert TSA and Homeland Security.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If he’s still in town, a guy like this won’t be easy to find. But we’ll dig in, hopefully make some headway by the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, the lonely PI burning the midnight oil, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who knew finding a purse could be this exhausting?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, did you figure out where the white limo took Ana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t even figure out whose limo it was. The taxi and limo commission has thousands of limos registered, but they’re not broken down by color so I’m working on plan B.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well … ready to get out of here? Call it a night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. What’s your rush, doll? Why don’t you stick around awhile, give those stems of yours a rest?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could I? I’m all alone and this is my first time in the big, scary city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Spare me the tall tale, precious. A dame like you? You’ve got an angle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re pretty quick for a gumshoe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. Spill the story. Time is money and I’ve got none of either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, I’ll give it to you straight. I’m just a girl looking for a private d*ck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Then your search is over, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This here … this is the double? Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Mr. Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Del Cordova, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were not expecting you.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Obviously. And you know what I was expecting? An update. From you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I totally forgot. I was – I was busy working the case.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: You said he was the best. Maybe your rating is not so objective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? I better be on my way. You two obviously have work to discuss.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Let me be plain, Mr. Castle. Have you found my purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet, though –

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: And what about where the white limousine took Ana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am following every lead. It’s only a matter of time.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Which is one thing I do not have. You’re fired, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Fired? You can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I just did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I don’t accept.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: You do understand how firing works?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. Effective immediately I’m hiring myself to solve this case.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: You can’t do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just did. I’m determined to see this through. And I’ve made it my mission to find your purse. Take a look at this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somewhere last night one of Anahita’s fans must have seen her in that limo. So I have been going over every post, every tweet, every comment, every photo of Ana that’s hit social media in the last 24 hours. I’ve set alerts on all of her fansites and I have a photo aggregator in case any new photos get posted. As a matter of fact, that is the sound of a fresh batch of photos arriving.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Not so fresh. This one is from last week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, well – – there. That one’s from last night. That’s her leaving the opera with the purse. There! There’s Ana leaving the limo. It looks like she’s in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: She doesn’t have my purse. Where’s – where’s the purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, wait. The photo’s time stamped. 11:03. That’s five minutes after she left the opera.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the usher said when she went to the limo she had her purse with her. If she’s leaving the limo five minutes later without the purse?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Then she left it inside the limousine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I find the limousine? I find your purse, Ms. Del Cordova.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: But how, without the license plate?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With that. That sticker has the VIN. The vehicle identification number. That’ll tell us exactly who this car is registered to. And I know just the person to trace that for me.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you are a genius. You are hired.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you awake?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I admit Sofia barging in on us was a little awkward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Try mortifying.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I was supposed to call her with an update. I had no idea she’d drop by to get it in person. And I’m – I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was actually kind of funny if you think about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. So I’m forgiven?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Forgiven enough to ask for a favor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm. Maybe. Depending on what you’re asking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How would you like to trace a VIN number for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God. Castle! You’re unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that’s a no?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we may have a location on our killer, Harlan Mathis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’d you pull that off?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, we knew he was out of town so we checked hotels, motels, and short-term housing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Building manager in Harlem recognized him from his photo. He checked in two weeks ago under the name James Heinman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No sign of Mathis.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. I think I may have an idea who hired him. Check it out. Security credentials for the Saudi consulate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Layla and her father are Saudi nationals. That can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. Why would they hire Mathis to kill Ana?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I bet this is exciting for you. Yeah, it’s not every day that the DMV gets to help the NYPD crack a homicide case. Really? Every day? Okay, well, if you just run that VIN number through your database, tell me who the limo is registered to. My name? It’s … Ryan. Uh huh. Detective Kevin Ryan. Badge number 42344. Uh huh. And do you have an address for the Danbridge group?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not here. Which means either the driver found the purse or –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t my limo.

utterance.speaker: HARLAN MATHIS
utterance.content: Give me your phone.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: You and I are going for a ride.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: What were you doing in the limo, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, this is going to sound crazy, but I was looking for a purse.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: A purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And it wasn’t there. So why don’t I just apologize for breaking into your car, you let me go, and we’ll just call it even.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: Whose purse is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um …

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: Whose purse?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anahita Menendez.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: What do you know about her and me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. Just that she left the limo without her purse.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: You’re lying. She never had a purse when she got in. Who hired you? Who are you really investigating? Me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Why would I investigate you?

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: The same reason the police are. Because Ana Menendez is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which you clearly had nothing to do with, so – Whoa. Okay, see, now that’s – that’s not necessary.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: I need to know what you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do know everything I know. I know nothing.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: Convince me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Harlan Mathis! NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop that knife! Now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turn around. Show me your hands.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was only trying to find Ana’s purse. How was I supposed to know the limo she was in was being driven by the guy that killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, do you realize how lucky you are?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Extremely lucky? After all, I’m married to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t even go there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What if we didn’t connect Harlan Mathis to the Danbridge group? What if that limo didn’t have Lo-Jack? We would have no way of finding you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You would if you had traced that VIN number for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s – not the lesson to take away here. Look, from now on I want you to tell me where you’re going and what you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, see, that’s not fair.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Neither is how we save your bacon and got nothing to show for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean, what is a rescue from certain death worth these days?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Floor seats to a few Knicks games?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: At the very least.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, rescued from certain death? Come on. I had him right where I wanted him. Fine. Floor seats.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, we looked into the Danbridge group. It is a front, controlled by a company owned by Abdul Nazif.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Saudi billionaire? He’s behind this? And Mathis works for him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We figure that Mathis forced Ana into the limo at the opera, stole her purse with the USB in it. Yes, Richard?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Mathis said that she didn’t have the purse when she got into the car. I think I know what happened. As Ana was leaving the opera house, she realized she was going to be abducted, so before she got into the limo she ditched the purse outside the opera house, where I will find it and solve my case! See, I’m telling you where I’m going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know where I’m going? To get a confession out of Harlan Mathis.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Where’re you going, floor seats?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Make the call.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: I have nothing to say to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you don’t grasp the situation, Mr. Mathis. With all the charges you’re facing, plus Anahita Menendez, by the time you get out of prison you’re going to be a senior citizen. Now, you were hired to abduct her, weren’t you? Is this supposed to be loyalty to your employer? Because they’ve got none towards you. I spoke to Abdul Nazif’s people and they claim to not know you. So you’re all alone here.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: What are you offering?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Consideration from the DA, if you tell me what happened with Ana.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: I was hired to secure Ms. Menendez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What were your orders?

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: To pick her up at the opera and bring her to Mr. Nazif.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: He wanted to speak with her. But she had refused to meet with him. I’m not clear on the specifics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the USB?

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: I don’t know about any USB. When she left the opera I escorted her to the limo. A few stop lights later she jumped out. Ran off. And I lost her. I don’t know what happened to her after that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I do. You caught up to her at her apartment and then you murdered her.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A witness saw you fleeing the crime scene. Your print is on her neck.

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: I went to her apartment to look for her. But she was already dead. That print is me checking for a pulse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You expect me to believe that someone else killed her? Who?

utterance.speaker: MATHIS
utterance.content: How should I know? But killing her was not my assignment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, Ronnie, just so we are completely clear, you remember seeing Ana out here with the purse?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s right. As the driver was escorting her into the white limo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. So it’s possible she handed it off to someone. Stashed it in a bag Enemy of the State style. Did you notice anyone near her?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Uh … just the limo driver.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, well, how far from the limo was she when you last saw her?

utterance.speaker: RONNIE
utterance.content: Uh, she was like, right there – – just near the curb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect, thank you, Ronnie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are getting to be an expensive habit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eww.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes! Ronnie! I might owe you a bigger tip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Where I come from it’s rude to look through a lady’s purse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ms. Del Cordova. You got here fast.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m very anxious to get that clutch back, as you well know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even if it’s a knockoff? These diamonds are fake. What’s really going on here?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m sure you’re mistaken. Please, give me the purse and its contents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m afraid I can’t do that. This USB drive is a part of the murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m afraid I must insist, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not your purse, is it? It’s not even Arthur Radcliffe’s. It’s Ana’s. You were after the USB drive the whole time. Why? What’s on it?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: That is not your concern.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You used me.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: You are a private eye. Doesn’t that come with the job?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You even fired me, knowing I’d work that much harder just to find the damn thing.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I could see you were like me, Mr. Castle. You hate to lose. But lose you must. The UBS, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s USB. And where I come from it’s rude to point a gun at a man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good lord, look at that. I mean, her going to prison? What a tragic waste. I just wish it would have been Harlan Mathis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why wasn’t it? What cleared him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The Lo-Jack in his limo proves that he wasn’t at Ana’s when she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re saying I solved my case, and your case, and I apprehended the killer. Hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. You disarmed a hundred and ten pound woman. Must’ve been a tense moment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mock, but I’m telling you, my online PI self-defense course, much like your Special Forces training, had me in the zone. It was like everything was moving in slow motion.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You do realize it was a prop gun, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. No bullets, plugged barrel. Harmless.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But since I didn’t know that at the time, my act of valor still stands.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So uh, tech went over that USB drive. Turns out it’s a dongle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh… what’s a dongle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh … what’s a dongle?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s basically an encrypted security key.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That unlocks what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: When tech plugged it in it routed them to an anonymous numbered bank account in Switzerland with a balance of one hundred million.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A hundred million bucks?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should’ve charged way more to find that purse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Del Cordova, where were you at 12:09 the night that Ana was killed?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: At home, in bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And can anyone corroborate that?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So tell me: why was Ana in possession of a security key to a Swiss bank account containing one hundred million dollars?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: I’m not at liberty to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, here’s my theory. Ana was involved in some kind of a business deal with Layla Nazif. Something secret, illegal, or both. Now, you either knew about the deal or you were involved in it, too. Feel free to jump in and correct me at any point. You went to Ana’s place to collect the money. She didn’t have the security key, so you killed her. And then you hired Castle to find it.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Ana and I were business partners, but I did not kill her. She was my friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of business, Sofia? Your future’s on the line, here.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Ana wanted to create the first Latin American, female driven television network. It was her dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A television network?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: She came to me because she needed someone with star power who knew the business. But we had to keep everything secret. If anyone had found out we were trying to leave Santos Desesperadas and the very network that created us, it would endanger the deal. But the pieces were almost in place. Ana had found an investor that she met with, a real estate man, to buy sound stages.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I take it that was Herman Eckles, and the investor was … Layla Nazif.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: But Layla’s father tried to stop her from investing. He didn’t want his name associated with a woman’s TV network. So she went behind his back and gave Ana the USB. Next thing I know, Ana was dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If what you’re saying is true, then why did you threaten Castle at gunpoint?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Because the money has to be in the escrow account by 5PM today or the deal is off. Time is running out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else knew about Ana’s meeting at the opera house?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: No one. She didn’t even tell me where she was going. She just said she was meeting Layla on the Upper West Side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did you and Ana have this conversation?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: In my trailer, where it is private. No one else was around.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Beckett, anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it looks like part of Sofia’s story holds up. She was at home the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Someone saw her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The doorman. He said she came in at 9:30 and she didn’t leave her apartment the whole night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So we searched Sofia’s trailer on set? You’ll never guess what we found.

utterance.speaker: GABRIELA
utterance.content: Enough with your lies! I know why you brought me onto this yacht!

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: Detectives. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you can explain this.

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: It’s a microphone like the ones we use to record the actors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except the actors involved didn’t know that they were being recorded. That was hidden in Sofia’s trailer.

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: Reprehensible. It’s probably the tabloids again. Believe me, I will find the person who did this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you won’t have to look too far. Your soundman caved. He admitted that you borrowed it from him last week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You probably suspected what Ana and Sofia were up to, and you knew that they talked in Sofia’s trailer, so you bugged it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s how you knew Ana was planning on leaving. And taking your biggest star with her.

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: I know nothing of this. These are outrageous accusations.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Those two women are the reason audiences watch. You knew that. If you let Ana go forward with her plan, where would that leave the network? Where would that leave you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Herrera, we circulated your photo. You were seen at the coffee shop down the street from Ana’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You waited for her to come home and then when she did, you snapped. Didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: FRANCISCO
utterance.content: I made Ana. Before me she was nobody, and she was going to ruin everything here. I begged her not to do it. But she refused to see reason. I never meant to kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Francisco Herrera, you’re under arrest for the murder of Anahita Menendez.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: It’s terrible what Francisco did. But Ana’s legacy will live on. We deposited the money in escrow twenty minutes before the deadline!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’ll still be able to launch the network.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Yes, the deal is complete. Layla and I agreed to co-run the company in Ana’s name. I’m sorry I deceived you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It comes with the job.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: And pulled a gun on you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which also comes with the job.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me, uh – I’m sorry. Ms. Del Cordova? I’m – I’m sorry to bother, but do you think you could sign this for my tía before you leave?

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SOFIA
utterance.content: What is her name?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Javier. Okay, it’s – it’s for me. I’ve just been such a big fan of yours for so long. You’re just so great in Santos Desesperadas. … and in “The Fire of Passion”. And in “Paths of Love” . And my favorite, “Chiquitas”. You were so very, very sexy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know what? Castle? We should probably get out of here before Gates sees you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Can I walk you home?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who knew a missing purse would turn into a case rife with mystery and intrigue? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, all I did was refer a case. You’re the one who solved it. So, how does it feel to have your first satisfied customer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like I want to satisfy another one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I think that can be arranged.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As the sun set over the mean streets of the naked city, I could feel my luck was about to change. The killer was caught, my case was closed, and hanging on my arm was the dame of my dreams.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you going to be doing that all night?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if it hurts my chances.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
